statement: Which of the following calculations gives the largest answer?
It has just turned 22:22. How many minutes are there until midnight?
What is the value of $\dfrac{12\;345}{1+2+3+4+5}$?
In this partly completed pyramid, each rectangle is to be filled with the sum of the two numbers in the rectangles immediately below it. What number should replace $x$?
The difference between $\tfrac{1}{3}$ of a certain number and $\tfrac{1}{4}$ of the same number is 3. What is that number?
What is the value of $x$ in the triangle? (diagram shows one angle 110°, one 120°; see paper)
The result of the calculation $123\;456\;789\times 8$ is almost the same as $987\;654\;321$ except that two of the digits are in a different order. What is the sum of these two digits?
Which of the following has the same remainder when it is divided by 2 as when it is divided by 3?

According to a newspaper report, "A 63-year-old man has rowed around the world without leaving his living room." He clocked up 25\,048 miles on a rowing machine that he received for his 50th birthday. Roughly how many miles per year has he rowed since he was given the machine?

In the expression $1\;\square\;2\;\square\;3\;\square\;4\;\square\;5$ each $\square$ is to be replaced by either + or \times. What is the largest value of all the expressions that can be obtained in this way?
What is the smallest prime number that is the sum of three different prime numbers?
A fish weighs the total of 2 kg plus a third of its own weight. What is the weight of the fish in kg?
In the figure shown, each line joining two numbers is to be labelled with the sum of the two numbers that are at its end points. How many of these labels are multiples of 3?

Digits on a calculator are represented by a number of horizontal and vertical illuminated bars. The digits and the bars which represent them are shown in the diagram. How many digits are both prime and represented by a prime number of illuminated bars?
Which of the following is divisible by all of the integers from 1 to 10 inclusive?
The diagram shows a square inside an equilateral triangle. What is the value of $x+y$? (see paper)

Knave of Hearts: "I stole the tarts." Knave of Clubs: "The Knave of Hearts is lying." Knave of Diamonds: "The Knave of Clubs is lying." Knave of Spades: "The Knave of Diamonds is lying." How many of the four Knaves were telling the truth?

Each of the fractions $\dfrac{2637}{18\,459}$ and $\dfrac{5274}{36\,918}$ uses the digits 1 to 9 exactly once. The first fraction simplifies to $\tfrac{1}{7}$. What is the simplified form of the second fraction?
One of the following cubes is the smallest cube that can be written as the sum of three positive cubes. Which is it?
The diagram shows a pyramid made up of 30 cubes, each measuring $1\times1\times1\,$m. What is the total surface area of the whole pyramid (including its base)?

Gill is now 27 and has moved into a new flat. She has four pictures to hang in a horizontal row on a wall which is 4800 mm wide. The pictures are identical in size and are 420 mm wide. Gill hangs the first two pictures so that one is on the extreme left of the wall and one is on the extreme right of the wall. She wants to hang the remaining two pictures so that all four pictures are equally spaced. How far should Gill place the centre of each of the two remaining pictures from a vertical line down the centre of the wall?
The diagram shows a shaded region inside a regular hexagon. The shaded region is divided into equilateral triangles. What fraction of the area of the hexagon is shaded?

The diagram shows four shaded glass squares, with areas 1 cm^2, 4 cm^2, 9 cm^2 and 16 cm^2, placed in the corners of a rectangle. The largest square overlaps two others. The area of the region inside the rectangle but not covered by any square (shown unshaded) is 1.5 cm^2. What is the area of the region where squares overlap (shown dark grey)?

A palindromic number is a number that reads the same when the order of its digits is reversed. What is the difference between the largest and smallest five-digit palindromic numbers that are both multiples of 45?

The four straight lines in the diagram are such that $VU=VW$. The sizes of $\angle VYZ$ and $\angle VZX$ are $x^\circ$, $y^\circ$ and $z^\circ$ as labelled. Which of the following equations gives $x$ in terms of $y$ and $z$?
